descs:
When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream,
Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon's
tail is flexible and configured to stretch.

Marill's oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see
just its tail bobbing on the water's surface, it's a sure
indication that this Pokémon is diving beneath the water to
feed on aquatic plants.
